review_title: Good college position with good coworkers and boss.
job_title: Academic Tutor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Boss will randomly do nice things like make peach cobbler. Keeps me fresh on topics from previous classes, this helped to prepare me for my FE (Fundamentals of Engineering) Exam. Coworkers are friendly and good to talk to during downtime.
cons: Some days can be very boring or very busy so you end up bored or worn out sometimes. Some students are harder to help than others but that honestly helps hone skills further. Poor pay since it's a university job.

review_title: Great place for working as a student while studying
job_title: Teaching Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: -Work schedule is flexible with your individual course schedule -They encourage you to prioritize your study's. -Allows for good balance between working and studying. -Good work culture
cons: -As a student if you want to keep the same position for multiple semesters you have to reapply again in the beginning of the fall semester each year. This is a bit annoying but not the end of the world.

review_title: Managerial behavior surprising for a university
job_title: Instructor Pilot in Cedar City, UT
pros: You can build hours fast if the aircraft are up.
cons: I worked there for a few years and have been on the receiving end of multiple screaming fits from management, and I’m not talking about frustrated management, I’m talking face red, vulgar screaming. There is a complete lack of continuity between campus culture and the aviation program. It’s hard to go to university presidential seminars where she talks about professionalism and inclusion when your boss screams and swears at you. The director thinks he’s immune to HR complaints (legitimately said it in a staff meeting).

job_title: Marketing Manager in Cedar City, UT
pros: Is awesome as a first job
cons: No cons, just great to work at.

job_title: Music Director in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good musical theatre programme. Great students. Cheap cost of living. Easy commute.
cons: LDS/Mormon superiority control complex. Not enough ability to be promoted to a faculty position from staff. Staff are denigrated to lesser roles, whilst faculty continue with more advancement. Not enough diversity.

job_title: Social Media Strategist in Cedar City, UT
pros: The experience students get is incredibly valuable.
cons: They pay half of what you could get at any fast food restaurant in town.

job_title: Sports Performance Coach in Cedar City, UT
pros: Cedar City is a great community
cons: The only con is the low salary

job_title: Flight Instructor in Cedar City, UT
pros: -safety oriented -goal driven -good place to build your career
cons: -suitable for lower time pilots

job_title: Assistant Professor in Cedar City, UT
pros: lots of opportunities and resources for research, open to new ideas and collaborating with others
cons: still working in terms of diversity issues, some resistance from the local community about politics and cultural issues

job_title: Professor in Cedar City, UT
pros: It's a beautiful location and campus; that's what sucks people in.
cons: It's just not worth it to work at SUU unless you are a straight, white, Mormon and preferably male. If you're not, expect to be marginalized.

review_title: Find a Different On Campus Job
job_title: Math Tutor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Works with your school schedule
cons: Demanding of your time and energy No good opportunities for pay increases

job_title: System Administrator in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good pay and benefits, time off, beautiful country.
cons: Lagging in innovation and application of new strategies

job_title: International Student Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Work varies Great Environment Amazing supervisors Works with schedule
cons: Not too many downsides really

job_title: Tutor Mentor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Fun people, flexible hours and a nice boss.
cons: The pay is not great. Do not rely on it as your only source of income.

job_title: Associate Professor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Beautiful area. Great students. Good faculty.
cons: Small-mindedness. Low pay. Expensive area to live in.

job_title: Director in Cedar City, UT
pros: Everyone is dedicated to serving students
cons: They ignore racism and the impact on employees and students

job_title: Admissions in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great work life balance, and ability to work at your own pace.
cons: Pay could be better for the amount of work required.

job_title: Certified Flight Instructor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Full time employment with salary and university benefits
cons: It is a public university with slow decision making

job_title: Coach in Cedar City, UT
pros: Family values friendly environment easy going
cons: They are not in a hurry to win

job_title: Director of Internal Audit in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great culture with Administration who care about their employees.
cons: It gets cold in the winter here in Cedar City, Utah

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good work life balance, good culture
cons: Salary just right no other cons

job_title: Aviation Mechanic in Cedar City, UT
pros: Super flexible schedule and management is friendly and understanding but at the same time very detail oriented when it comes to maintenance.
cons: Not much room for growth.

review_title: Over promise, under deliver - Higher education
job_title: Senior Director in Cedar City, UT
pros: It's a government job so you will not be overworked and there is plenty of time to update your status and play games.
cons: You will be involved with committees but your input will not matter. Most of the work assignments will be busy work that ultimately are at the support of the Utah Summer Games or the Shakespeare Festival. Small town politics are abundant and real world industry or educational experience to share with students have little value to the university.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Cedar City, UT
pros: 5 national parks within a day's drive
cons: Very much influenced by Mormon church and culture, even in terms of hiring practices and it becomes borderline inappropriate/unprofessional on the employee side of things

job_title: Sustainability Intern in Cedar City, UT
pros: Some jobs work with you so you can take classes.
cons: There is no benefits for part-time

job_title: IT Help Desk Support in Cedar City, UT
pros: Get paid to answer phone calls and make tickets and when there arent any calls being made or people needing help then you can work on homework
cons: Gets rather boring, and is nothing really worth bragging about

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Flexible times and good coworkers
cons: Nothing really that bad there.

job_title: Lead Heat Plant Operator in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great Work/Home Life Balance, Great Benefits, Lots of time off, Very flexible and cares about employees, free classes
cons: Pay could be better but is government based.

job_title: Custodial Specialist in Cedar City, UT
pros: You get weekends and Holidays off. Maintaining student employees is a top priority for them. They work with your school schedule.
cons: They don't pay a lot. If you work in the Shakespeare buildings, you have to work some weekends in the summer.

job_title: AV Technician in Cedar City, UT
pros: Team really helped each other both in training and in the AV setups. they also kept an overall positive attitude
cons: pay was very poor especially considering the work was pretty skill intensive

review_title: Time as Object Oriented programming TA
job_title: TEACHERS ASSISTANT in Cedar City, UT
pros: Very flexible with schedule and super chill
cons: Sometimes have to travel to class to teach

job_title: Resident Assistant (RA) in Cedar City, UT
pros: Fun to meet new students starting their education.
cons: Toxic workplace environment, with little leniency.

job_title: Marketing and Events Assistant in Tooele, UT
pros: This job is catered towards getting me the experience I want.
cons: The pay is not good... but it is also an internship

job_title: Lifeguard in Cedar City, UT
pros:
-Coworkers
-Relationships with Managers
-Free Gym Pass
-Flexible around school schedule
-Able to become an Event Manager for Water Polo Tournaments/Swim meets
cons:
-Pay was lower when I was there
-Can be difficult to get shifts covered

job_title: Student Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great work-school balance, always get the weekends off and holidays if necessary.
cons: Does not pay super well

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar City, UT
pros: everything about it is super good
cons: it does not have a lot that is bad

job_title: Postal Worker in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good hours, flexible schedule, good co-workers
cons: unorganized, high turnover, poor training methods

job_title: Research Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great resume builder, the professors are great to work with. You get one on one mentoring.
cons: low pay rate which is non-negotiable.

job_title: Lecturer in Cedar City, UT
pros: Small campus, easy to know people
cons: The school focuses on grout and doesn't update the salaries with years

job_title: Student Grader in Cedar City, UT
pros: Get to review a class you have already passed.
cons: It can be a bit tedious grading for large classes.

job_title: Student Center Manager in Cedar City, UT
pros: Friendly team to work with and great atmosphere
cons: Pay is low and there is no room for raise.

job_title: Admissions Advisor in Brigham City, UT
pros: Ability to work freely and with a group of people who are passionate about SUU.
cons: Starting pay is not super great but if you are willing to take your lumps it can increase.

review_title: Great place for current students to work
job_title: Research Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros:
Flexible hours
Research topics that are relevant to the real world
cons:
Too flexible can leave you feeling lost
Time dependent on professor availability

job_title: Lecturer in Cedar City, UT
pros:
Committed people that want to make education a good experience for the students
Proximity to beautiful parts of southern Utah
Small campus
cons:
Pay is low
Teaching load is high
No pathway for qualified non-tenure track faculty to transition to tenure track

review_title: Good place for a student to work
job_title: Landscaper in Cedar City, UT
pros: They are very flexible with hours and treat you as a student.
cons: You have to do snow removal early in the morning.

job_title: Web Developer in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great benefits, beautiful campus, good people
cons: Like all higher ed. institutes that are funded by government, the pay is not ver competitive with private sector jobs.

job_title: Teacher in Cedar City, UT
pros: Boss, Schedule, Time, Pay, Co Workers
cons: Work Place, Facilities, Benefits, Food

review_title: Don't work at the entrepreneurship center
job_title: Marketing Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: The entrepreneurship center is probably the most interesting job on campus. You get to spend time around some of the brightest entrepreneurs in Utah. The amount of things you'll learn and people you'll meet is tough to beat.
cons: The working environment is the most toxic I have ever experienced. Tyler Stillman is a horrible, horrible boss. Every single employee that I worked with there eventually left because they couldn't handle the way he treated them. I can't believe he is still in this position.

job_title: Media Buyer in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great place for health benefits and retirement
cons: salary wasn't very good here.

job_title: Intern in Cedar City, UT
pros: Open and Flexible, very understanding of personal life
cons: I don't have any cons for this position.

job_title: IT Help Desk in Kwun Tong, Kowloon City
pros: Very accommodating to your schedule
cons: May have to work late at night

job_title: Data Analyst in Hong Kong
pros: Free time to practice many projects.
cons: Can be hard to find a starting point to work on.

job_title: Research Assistant in Hong Kong
pros: they had good benefits as in medical and dental
cons: more work and pay stayed the same

job_title: GTA Graduate Teaching Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: I love working as a GTA in the communication department at SUU. The faculty are so helpful and our supervisor is always willing to help out. It has been such an amazing experience and I have loved working with the students.
cons: The only con is that you can only work as a teaching assistant while in the graduate program. I have loved working as a GTA and wish I could keep doing it after I graduate.

job_title: Janitorial in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good hours for students, good team, basic intellectual use
cons: Very physical, late hours sometimes, low pay rate

job_title: CSIS Tutor/Grader in Cedar City, UT
pros:
- Very hands-off, we are trusted to do our jobs well without our time being wasted by management so long as we don't get complaints. 
- Hours are flexible, as required by a college student taking a campus job.
cons: - Low pay as you might expect for a campus job.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar City, UT
pros: Awesome faculties, small class size, facilities are new
cons: Currently does not have master program for geology

job_title: Sign Shop Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: You can't work past 5 pm and they work well with your school schedule. You never have to work holidays or week ends
cons: Not a lot of the student jobs pay very much.

review_title: Great place to start your CFI career
job_title: Certified Flight Instructor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great bosses to work for, Low cost of living with ample salary, flexibility with schedule as long as you hit the semester deadlines, the Cirrus are great to instruct in, and the maintenance team here is sooooo good. No pressure to fly unairworthy aircraft whatsoever. Salary pay makes my paycheck predictable, which is a great improvement to overall quality of life. Downed aircraft and bad weather don't affect my ability to support myself.
cons: Long days, all flight school records still done on paper, not an astounding amount of flight hours compared to other places, can be under lots of pressure to finish your students on time.

job_title: Student Programmer in Cedar City, UT
pros: Nice place to work at
cons: little behind the times, but that's aight

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar City, UT
pros: Really great education for the money.
cons: No cons. It was great when they lowered prices during covid.

job_title: Teacher's Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Excellent teachers who are willing to work with student employees and their schedules
cons: Hours are not always guaranteed and can vary based on what the teacher needs

job_title: Assistant Coach in Cedar City, UT
pros: Love the coaching environment and the community.
cons: Hours are very random and sometimes could be 18 hour days

job_title: Coordinator in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great people, beautiful location, student centered approach.
cons: Cost of living is out pacing wages

job_title: Certified Flight Instructor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Benefits, organization, salary, pass rate, proficiency
cons: Priority of rotor vs fixed wing

job_title: Graduate Admissions Advisor in Cedar City, UT
pros:
Flexibility
Good leadership 
Great team
Nice workplace
Good location in town
cons: Nothing has really been negative in my experience

job_title: Boiler Operator in Cedar City, UT
pros: Benefits are great. Flexible Schedule. Free Tuition. Relaxed environment. Low Stress. Lots of time off.
cons: Pay is on the low end. Shift times change with season.

job_title: Tutor in Cedar City, UT
pros: The center can be great while working with students or your coworkers.
cons: The supervisor in the tutoring center is not very cordial.

job_title: Student Office Worker in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good hours and the teachers are very kind
cons: I don't feel like I have any cons

job_title: Lecturer in Cedar City, UT
pros: Internal advancement, small, tight-knit community, great leadership at department-level.
cons: Terrible provost, likely changing to an open-enrollment model.

job_title: Helicopter Pilot in Cedar City, UT
pros: great benefits and great coworkers
cons: the administration is constantly fighting the VA

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Flexible with school and class schedule
cons: NA NA NA NA NA

job_title: Student Writing Center Tutor in Cedar City, UT
pros:
* Often have time for homework on the clock
* Opportunities to present at conferences
* Summer oppportunity to tutor in China
cons: * Boss is difficult to get a commitment from

job_title: Admissions Advisor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great place to work for.
cons: There are no cons working for SUU

job_title: Senior Director in Cedar City, UT
pros: Stable and consistent employment and benefits
cons: Tied to government funding and limitations

job_title: Assistant Professor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great place to work and great community.
cons: Salaries are low, but opportunities for supplemental income.

job_title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good work environment, wonderful people.
cons: I have no complaints about the university.

job_title: Editor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Staff is friendly and very knowledgeable.
cons: Pay and work life balance.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar City, UT
pros: There is always an exciting project coming up. I have flexibility with my time.
cons: Sometimes keeping the workload balanced can be stressful. I just schedule out every moment of my day until I'm through the project.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar City, UT
pros: Best job I ever had
cons: It was not easy to work during the night while attending college

job_title: Director in Cedar City, UT
pros: great place to work and learn
cons: no cons for my review

review_title: Not what you might hope for
job_title: Professor in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Small community, clean air and water. Beautiful environment.
cons: Cliches and low pay limited opportunity for growth.

job_title: Peer Tutor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Rewarding, School Holidays Off, Flexible Scheduling
cons: Stays Open During A Pandemic

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: flexible hours, frequent opportunities, great environment
cons: Busy, little downtime, challenging, and intensive.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Flexible schedule as a full-time student.
cons: There were no cons working for Southern Utah University.

job_title: Flight Instructor in Cedar City, UT
pros: SUU offers decent benefits and the pay isn't bad for Cedar City. The Aviation program has potential to be the best in the state and operates some of the best equipment in the flight training industry.
cons: When SUU separated from Upper Limit Aviation and became their own operation, they forgot to fire the management that was the real source of most issues. Upper management is unprofessional, offers no positive feedback and regularly threatens their employees. Aircraft spend most time in maintenance and the lab fees they charge students is nothing short of criminal. You do not want to work for these people. They will use you then stab you in the back. Upfront the operations seems great. New Cirrus Airplanes and Robinson Helicopters, full time positions, salaried. You might even be promised 70 + hours of flight time a month. This WILL NOT happen. You will be lucky to log 40 hours all while management blames you for the lack flying and student progress. Fly for someone else.

review_title: Be aware of who is managing you
job_title: Fixed Wing Line Instructor in Cedar City, UT
pros: descent salary pay, new nicely equipped aircraft and fleet. Good maintenance department.
cons: Bad management,  Poor policies enforcement and creation.  Good to work for until they need to change policy or requirements in there best interest and will turn on there own employees to save there own back. They will create lies to make themselves look right, and management is egotistical. Beware they will not support you or have your back when you need it and wont hesitate to screw you over even if it makes them look better but hurts them financially. Check airmen are also inexperienced and very egotistical, have heard lots of lies said behind peoples back. Not very good communication or leadership skills involved. They will also find ways to write up instructors whenever they want that are borderline illegal and definitely against school policies, but HR wont acknowledge it.

job_title: Mechanic in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good benefits as far as mechanics pay, retirement, 401K. In August 2016, we converted from Upper Limit Aviation to SUU employees and it was like getting a $400 a month pay raise because of benefits. Can't beat it in Cedar City.
cons: We no longer get overtime, it is comp time. We work long hours because of limited aircraft and our students are behind on hours for the semester. We are rewarded in comp time, but the floor manager doesn't remember when we schedule (with him) our time off. He even asks several of us to come in on our time off because he doesn't schedule his mechanics properly-it's not our fault! Recently, the maintenance manager yells at us during every meeting he attends, but the lack of aircraft isn't our fault because he was the one who went on pre-buys for the aircraft we have now and they are lemons.

job_title: Marketing Assistant, English Language Study Center in Cedar City, UT
pros: Instructors shared information, insights, and knowledge in a qualified, skillful and personal manner to students.  Office hours were honored by delivering helpful and building information for improvement to student assignments.  Most resources needed for completing education were available.  Students were aware of deadlines and yet there was a sense of being able to absorb and use what they were learning in a meaningful applied manner.  I was glad for the variety of instructors that personally dedicated themselves to their work and passed on a love for the subjects they taught.  I felt motivated to reach goals that were achievable.
cons: I cannot think of any downsides.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Everyone was very friendly, great benefits (free tuition for employees and spouses, plus time off work to take a class, excellent health care coverage), abundance of new opportunities. The town is small and friendly, campus is beautiful and you're close to everything.
cons: Some of the school programs annoyed me. There was a program encouraging employees to donate part of their salary back to the school - if everyone in your department participated, your department got a plaque to display. So there was a lot of pressure to participate, and being someone who wasn't paid all that much, I wasn't really in a position to just give up part of my salary.

review_title: Great place to start as an instructor
job_title: Helicopter Pilot in Cedar City, UT
pros:
- Great pay and benefits compared to other helicopter schools
- Well maintained aircraft, hangar, and equipment
- Good safety culture
- Ongoing training and support for instructors
- Upper management care about their employees and the company
- Beautiful location to fly
cons:
- Flight courses are based on university semesters, once you complete your students you have to wait till the next semester for new students.
- A lot of SOPs and local rules for noise abatement that can be frustrating to navigate around

review_title: A legend in their own minds
job_title: Department Supervisor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Close to world famous hiking.  When you're in education and your best marketing product is a national park close by, be weary of the level of academic outcome.
cons: Poor health insurance - EMI.  Getting a process out of a committee or discussion is next to impossible.  You're in the club, or not - you find out very quickly.  Most of their 'scholarly' faculty are products of their own institution and not open to the real world.

review_title: Lots of freedom which means lots of unpaid overtime.
job_title: Graphic Designer in Cedar City, UT
pros: I liked that I had a lot of creative freedom as a designer. I was able to direct the theme and outcome of almost all of my projects and make some great portfolio pieces.
cons: Large workload, and due to low budget, they couldn't hire more employees to help. Low budget also meant lower quality printing which doesn't help much. I also wish there wasn't so much red tape around events- that could cause issues with timing for projects.

review_title: The management runs SUU like it is the Gestapo
job_title: ESL Teacher in Cedar City, UT
pros: my students, who deserve much better
cons: Everything: there was not one positive thing about working for SUU.  They tried to intimidate their employees to lie and cheat!

review_title: It was great with a really nice manager. I was a lifeguard for lap swimming so it was just such a great college job.
job_title: Lifeguard in Cedar City, UT
pros: I loved my coworkers and the swimmers got to know me. Once in a while there were no swimmers and I got to study and get paid for it! :)
cons: Kind of an isolated spot to be in and in the three years I worked there I felt there wasn't a lot of specific instructions on how to do things. But I figured stuff out.

job_title: ESL Teacher in Cedar City, UT
pros: There are no pros in my job except for my students.
cons: I teach over 30 hours a week for a program that hires unqualified teachers (we have teachers that do not have college degrees, and the vast majority of our teachers have no academic training in the field we teach in).  Even though I have a master's degree and I am in front of a class for over 30 hours a week, I do not receive benefits.  I am paid a low hourly wage, and I am not paid for lesson planning or grading papers. There are some weeks, especially during peak grading periods, that I do not make minimum wage. The job is a joke!

review_title: It was great, then a new boss made it less great
job_title: Math Tutor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Flexible scheduling with classes, pay is comparable to other on campus part time jobs.
cons: Little to no raises, demanding, not fun work environment, little support from management

job_title: Student Body President in Cedar City, UT
pros:
Small class sizes, taught by the professor, close interaction with peers.
Tremendous opportunities to get involved academically, socially, and with the community.
Awesome location if you love the outdoors.
St. George is close - shopping, great weather year round.
High quality education.
Very safe community.
Low cost of living.
Amazing Alumni and Community.
cons:
Difficult job placement in some fields (out of touch with Salt Lake area.)
Not as well known throughout Utah or the country.
Rural town - not much shopping (if you're into that)

review_title: A good place to go to school.  Not enough work to stay there after.
job_title: Student A/V Technician in Cedar City, UT
pros: College campus and student environment.  Great to be able to work and go to school in the same place.  Working alongside fellow students. Gained many skills that I still use today in my own personal life.
cons: Department was run  by students that were told school was first priority, but called a few times during classes to set up events.  Expectations were very high for a part time employee.

review_title: Great small university with mission to be a public liberal arts and sciences institution.
job_title: Associate Professor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Both faculty and staff work individually with students in small classes and have lots of collaborative experiences on campus.  The campus is in a rural area, but there are cultural and outdoor opportunities locally and within 100 miles that make it a wonderful place to live.
cons: Staff were underpaid, but its also a community where the cost of living is low compared to a metropolitan area.

job_title: Mechanic in Cedar City, UT
pros: Benefits are good, its a state run program so medical and dental are better than most.
cons: Terrible work environment, management will force you to put your license on the line or get fired. They open job advancements that they themselves don't even meet qualifications for. Was told to return aircraft to service illegally several times with threatening of my position. I would not recommend anyone to work here if you have any ethics.

job_title: Writing Fellow in Cedar City, UT
pros: I was able to directly see the impact that my efforts had on my students. I was able to set my own schedule, and create a program entirely on my own.
cons: I was paid a straight rate of $100/pay period, making my extra hours fruitless when it came to being paid.

job_title: Student Body President in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great environment and great location in Cedar City.  The staff and professors were always very helpful and there is a student centric attitude.
cons: I honestly don't have any cons to mention at this time.  In my opinion, it was a fantastic place to work.

job_title: A&P Mechanic in Cedar City, UT
pros: you can get experience here but only on small helicopters and fixed aircraft.
cons: The managers do not know how to conduct business in a professional manner. Plan on getting yelled at a lot in a group for the short comings of the managers. If the university would step in and remove the inexperience and get qualified individuals in a management position the company would be very successful.

job_title: Custodian in Cedar City, UT
pros: Loved working at the college, they worked really well with class schedules and it was a good job for finding time to focus on classes and studying along with student life.
cons: The job starts early in the morning, if you aren't a morning person this isn't a job for you.

job_title: Student Custodian in Cedar City, UT
pros: Very flexible student job. My boss let me work the hours I wanted and was flexible when I asked for days off. The work itself was very calming, as I was just cleaning one of the buildings on campus. There were some meetups for the facilities department as a whole to facilitate a sense of community.
cons: Didn't earn very much for the work done.

job_title: Flight Instructor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Take care of employees and great maintenance crew.  Upper management was always there to help
cons: Weather could be bad at times which affected the flight schedule and hours. Upper management needed to pay attention to line pilots

job_title: Digitization Specialist in Cedar City, UT
pros: As a student, they are very, very flexible in working around your schedule. The faculty members are kind and extremely helpful. You are also given the opportunity to self start and work independently daily. It is definitely a great experience if you are looking for a decent job to cover basic expenses while in college.
cons: Not much room from growth.

job_title: Math Tutor in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great student job, worked around class schedule.  Working with the faculty was amazing, they really cared for the students they taught.  Coworkers were great, and watching students understand new concepts made it all worth it.
cons: No full-time positions available, "student-level" pay

job_title: Accounts Payable Clerk in Cedar City, UT
pros: Flexible schedule for college students.
cons:
Repetitive
Supervisor dumped a lot of their own work onto clerks in addition to our own work we needed to do

job_title: Event Director in Cedar City, UT
pros: Amazing staff. They were unbelievably nice, and were passionate about helping people grow in their field. They welcome you with open arms and teach you the ropes.
cons: Religion is a dominant factor in this region, so it is typical to feel excluded sometimes if you do not practice the same religion.

job_title: IIC Crew Manager in Cedar City, UT
pros: Great experience for management with crew work in the public lands! Ability to be creative and independent at work. Great office and supervisors!
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement. Low pay and not a lot of direction for position. Long hours in harsh environment at times.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Cedar City, UT
pros: Good co-workers. Great benefits, good sense of community
cons: There is little to no opportunities for advancement. if you get a bad supervisor there is about nothing that will make things better for you. Bad employees stick around for decades, good employees get pushed out or leave for greener pastures.

job_title: Graduate Assistant in Cedar City, UT
pros: Working on cutting edge technologies with some of the faculty members can be exciting. Southern Utah University has some of the leaders in education.
cons: In the academia world, some educators do not continue to keep updated with the latest trends. Keeping up on the latest trends, especially in cyber security, is a must.

job_title: Associate Professor in East Lake, FL
pros: University makes moderate attempt at keeping salaries within 70% of national standards.
cons: Cost of living, primarily because of remoteness, is a bit higher than other schools from same category. The COL is offset a bit by the wide variety of activities, including access to 5 of the nation's BEST national parks.

job_title: Assistant Graduate Recruiter in Cedar City, UT
pros: Very flexible, on campus, one of the higher paying jobs on campus, great skills and habits learned, fun environment and coworkers.
cons: Call center type job. Sometimes you have cold lists and you end up calling tons of people just to be hung up on or end up leaving a voicemail.

review_title: Great experience for students in relevant fields.
